name: Albania
description: Albania, a Balkan nation nestled between the Adriatic and Ionian Seas, boasts a dramatic landscape of rugged mountains, pristine coastlines, and ancient historical sites.  Its diverse geography, shaped by tectonic activity and glacial erosion, contributes to a rich tapestry of ecosystems and a unique cultural heritage.  From the towering peaks of the Albanian Alps to the turquoise waters of the Riviera, Albania offers a captivating blend of adventure, relaxation, and cultural immersion.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The vibrant capital city, known for its colorful buildings and lively atmosphere.
quickFacts.detail: Tirana is a hub of commerce, culture, and education, offering a glimpse into modern Albania.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: A relatively young population with a growing economy.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population resides in urban areas, particularly around Tirana and Durrës.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: A compact nation with diverse geographical features.
quickFacts.detail: Albania's territory includes coastal plains, mountainous regions, and a significant portion of the Balkan Peninsula.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: An Indo-European language with unique roots.
quickFacts.detail: Albanian has distinct dialects, reflecting the country's historical and geographical divisions.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The Lek is pegged to the Euro, though physical currency is still widely used.

climateData.title: Albanian Climate
climateData.description: Albania experiences a Mediterranean climate, characterized by hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters.  The coastal regions enjoy a more temperate climate than the mountainous interior.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June-August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Hot and sunny with clear skies, ideal for beach activities and outdoor adventures.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September-November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Pleasant temperatures and colorful foliage, perfect for hiking and exploring.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December-February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Cold and snowy in the mountains, mild and rainy along the coast.  A good time for skiing and cultural experiences.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March-May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Mild temperatures and blossoming flowers, a beautiful time to visit.

naturalWonders.name: Albanian Alps (Bjeshkët e Namuna)
naturalWonders.description: The Albanian Alps, also known as Bjeshkët e Namuna, are a rugged and remote mountain range offering breathtaking scenery and challenging hiking trails.  They are a haven for wildlife and a testament to Albania's untouched natural beauty.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: These mountains are characterized by dramatic peaks, deep valleys, and glacial lakes. The region is sparsely populated, preserving its traditional way of life and pristine environment.  The Valbona and Theth valleys are particularly popular destinations.

naturalWonders.name: Llogara National Park
naturalWonders.description: Llogara National Park is a stunning coastal park offering panoramic views of the Ionian Sea and a diverse range of flora and fauna.  It's a popular destination for hiking, camping, and enjoying the Mediterranean sunshine.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park encompasses steep cliffs, lush forests, and pristine beaches.  It's home to a variety of bird species, including golden eagles and vultures. The Llogara Pass offers spectacular views and is a popular route for drivers.

naturalWonders.name: Lake Ohrid
naturalWonders.description: Lake Ohrid is one of Europe's oldest and deepest lakes, a UNESCO World Heritage site renowned for its unique biodiversity and stunning scenery.  It's a popular destination for swimming, boating, and exploring the surrounding villages.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The lake is home to numerous endemic species of fish and plants, making it a vital center of biodiversity. The town of Ohrid, located on the lake's shores, boasts a rich history and beautiful architecture.  The Drilon National Park offers stunning views and hiking trails.
viewingTips: Take a boat trip on the lake
Visit the Church of St. John at Kaneo

ecosystemData.title: Albanian Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Albania’s ecosystems are remarkably diverse, ranging from Mediterranean forests and wetlands to alpine meadows and rocky slopes.  The country’s unique geographical location and varied climate contribute to this rich biodiversity.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: Albania’s forests cover approximately 30% of the country’s land area, providing habitat for a wide range of plant and animal species.

statistics.details: Diverse range of deciduous and coniferous trees

notableSpecies.name: Black Pine
notableSpecies.significance: Dominant tree species in the mountainous regions

biodiversityCategories.name: Wetlands
biodiversityCategories.description: Albania’s wetlands, including marshes, swamps, and lagoons, are vital habitats for migratory birds and other wildlife.

statistics.details: Important for flood control and water purification
Significant stopover point for migratory birds

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Albania
activities.description: Albania offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all levels of experience, from challenging hikes to relaxing beach days.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Albania’s stunning mountains and valleys on foot.

activities.name: Valbona Hike
activities.description: A classic hike through the Albanian Alps, connecting the Valbona and Theth valleys.
activities.requirements: Hiking boots, backpack, water bottle, appropriate clothing

activities.name: Peaks of the Balkans Trail
activities.description: A challenging multi-day trek through the Albanian Alps, Montenegro, and Kosovo.
activities.requirements: Excellent fitness level, backpacking experience, navigation skills

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the Mediterranean Sea and Albania’s numerous lakes.

activities.name: Swimming
activities.description: Relax and swim in the crystal-clear waters of the Albanian Riviera.

activities.name: Kayaking
activities.description: Explore the coastline and hidden coves by kayak.

clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket, hat, gloves

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, map, compass
